name: The Greenporter Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff here was very nice and we really appreciated that. The breakfast that was included was fine. The heated pool was not heated but it was open late in September which was nice. The bed was not great and in fact made noise every time we turned. But they did provide a crib for our baby which was also very nice. The room was also clean. It was not bad but I would also explore other options in Greenport.
reviews.title: Nice staff, but just okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hubby and I make an annual trip out to the North Fork for our anniversary. We've stayed at several other hotels but, we like the Greeporter the best. Their restaurant, Cuvee, is fabulous and, the hotel is clean, clean, clean. Very minimalist in style but, comfy. Last time there was a tremendous storm that sounded like it would bring the place down but, it certainly did not. Not even a leak or disruption in electric. Will be there again soon.
reviews.title: Stay every year for past 4 years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is much less elegant than I expected from the photographs. From years past, I can remember thinking it seemed too rich for our budget. The commercial carpet and tile are a turnoff, as are the outdoor fixtures indoors. The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows too small. The bathroom was clean and large, everything in good working order. Having a fridge was nice. It was mid-September so we didn't use the pool.
reviews.title: Modest place, good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You have to keep in mind the East End of Long Island is prime tourist territory, so if it seems expensive it's because of the area. To one side it's residential and maybe not desirable, but in the other direction it's a short distance into town. You can walk unless you're too lazy, like me.
reviews.title: Third Time: Still a Charm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We continue to return to the Greenporter for its great location, large-sized clean rooms, pool, fridge in the room, and easy parking. Yes, it's not the most luxe of accommodations, but I appreciate the Ikea asthetic.
reviews.title: WE HAVE BEEN BACK OVER AND OVER AGAIN........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at the Greenporter for one evening, mid-week in late August and my visit was a pleasant one. The inside accomodations had a modern, European feel. The room and bathroom were very clean as were all the lines and towels. The bed was extremely comfortable. I had a wonderful night's sleep. The area surrounding the facility was quiet and peaceful and I could not hear any of the other guests. The artwork in the room appeared to be that of a younger child/teen and while good, did not quite fit with the "vibe" of the decor. A t.v., refrigerator, hair dryer and ample lighting were all present and working well. The bathroom was large in size and did not leave me feeling cramped as I usually do when staying at an accomodation outside my home. The vent in the bathroom was somewhat noisy but not too much of a bother. There were no tissues in the room but plenty of toilet paper. The Greenporter is a "green" hotel. The fact that they're environmentally aware is another plus for this place. The front-desk staff was helpful in directing me to some local beaches. They provided a beach pass after collecting a reasonable deposit which was returned upon my bringing the pass back. The Greenporter's proximity to the downtown area in Greenport is within reasonable walking distance. The continental breakfast found next door in Cuvee's Restaurant was simple but nice and tasty and provided for during resonable morning hours. The front-desk staff and others working at the Greenporter were pleasant and helpful. They helped contribute to making my time out east relaxing and stress-free.
reviews.title: Enjoyable, relaxing overnight getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We randomly found this place on our impromptu trip to Greenport. After $200 a night dumps in Montauk, this place was a welcomed step up. Nothing luxurious but it was clean, quiet, comfy bed and the staff was very friendly. Complimentary breakfast is an unexpected touch. Plus, you're right in town. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Best budget option in Greenport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a great few days in Greenport (myself, my husband and our 2.5 year old daughter) and a lot was due to the Greenporter.
reviews.title: Perfect place if you set your expectations right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: - Great location
reviews.title: Great find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a last minute trip to Greenport and my favorite place had no room so on a whim we tried the Greenporter and was pleasantly surprized.
reviews.title: Better Than Expected, Would Go Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a King Deluxe room, it was large and furnished in a slightly retro 50s vibe which I loved. The bathroom was larger than expected given that this is essentially a spruced up old motel. The pool was nice though the lounge chairs and fencing could be perked up. Nice touch was the free breakfast. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location but not an excellent value for your money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent 1 night at the Greenporter this past weekend after a day of tasting wine on the North Fork. It is certainly convenient to North Fork at the end of your day, and in great walking distance to a ton of great spots in Greenport. The check in was lovely and the overall amenities in terms of restaurant, breakfast, etc were great. The rooms are dated and therefore dirty. The tile was grungy and the bath towels pretty thin. The carpeting was stained in some areas. The positive is the lovely pool area and new flatscreen tv's. Additionally there is a/c and it's extremely strong. This could be good or bad depending on your preference. The best analogy I can come up with is that if Ikea were to have built a hotel 10 years ago - this is it with new tv's. Another plus is free parking on site. Not terrible . . .just not what I expected for $225/night.
reviews.title: What a dump.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I read pretty mixed reviews on here about the Greenporter with some people saying it was great with amazing service and sleek decor, to others saying it was a cheap motel. I agree with the latter. If you're looking to stay at a redone motel that knows SERVICE, check out the Roxbury in upstate NY. The Greenporter looks like it hasn't been remodeled since 1970...the floor in my room was half wood, half carpet (which I was skeeved to step on). I wore flip flops the entire weekend because I was grossed out to even put my FOOT on the floor. The furnishings were ancient and looked like my college dorm room. And nothing about this room is clean.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then theres the air conditioner...which turned off and on all night and even when I moved the vents, continued to blow directly on me, which was great as I was getting over a cold. And it woke me up everytime it switched on and off.
reviews.title: Absolutely splendid experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend, and had a good time visiting the area.
reviews.title: Good hotel at a good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pluses: Parking is ample, and downtown is within walking distance (as is the ferry to Shelter Island and the LIRR stop, if you need it); the staff were very friendly and helpful; the continental breakfast was delicious and filling.
reviews.title: A home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Minuses: The motel was a weird contrast--for a hotel catering to the "upper crust" (lots of luxury cars in the parking lot!), the interior fencing was downright ugly, and yet, the rooms might be too modern for some (platform beds that are low to the floor, the shelves are made of plywood, etc.). Plus, the pool hours seemed to be limited (9-6, even on weekends).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely consider returning here, but wouldn't consider our stay so amazing that we'd only consider booking here in the future. I wouldn't consider it a "romantic spot," but it might be good for families on a budget.
reviews.title: Perfect for our needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, sister and brother in law and I went to the vineyards for a weekend getaway. Having never been to the Greenporter before, we did not know what to expect. After a full day at the wineries, we checked in to the hotel and could not have been more impressed. The front desk was helpful and accommodating and the rooms are plain, but were extremely clean. We made reservations at Cuvee for dinner and could not have been more impressed with the food and service. Every item we ordered was prepared beautifully and was delicious. It was apparent that the food was fresh. It is officially one of my favorite restaurants.
reviews.title: A little gem that combines ultra-friendly service and superb food

description: The Greenporter Hotel is an alternative for travelers who want an alternative to traditional B&Bs. It is a small, privately owned hotel and restaurant located in the heart of the North Fork’s wine country, in Greenport, Long Island. The Greenporter Hotel is located at the entrance of The Village of Greenport and is a short walk from village docks, boutiques, restaurants, and galleries in downtown historic Greenport. The hotel is just across the Long Island Sound and minutes away from Shelter Island, as well as the Long Island Railroad and the Hampton Jitney. The hotel is designed in a minimalistic 1950’s retro style with your modern day amenities. The property has 30 guestrooms which convey the feel of a comfortable beach house for the guest seeking a casual but stylish setting. All rooms feature a queen or king size bed, private bath, flat screen cable television, air conditioning, mini fridge, in-room coffee maker as well as daily maid service. The restaurant on-site serves some of the area's best dishes and cocktails featuring selections from local farmers, fisherman and winemakers.
